metadata.synopsis: An act of cowardice influences the lives of two Basque families over three generations.

reviews: Vicente Ameztoy shines. [Full Review in Spanish]
His movie is swift and urgent - it's closer to Jane Campion than Carlos Saura - and he has a sharp eye for la vida loca.
More successfully than any film in recent memory, "Cows" brings to the screen the epic sweep and magical realist sensibility found in the work of writers like Gabriel Garcia Marquez.
He fails as often as he succeeds. With so many loose ends, you could make a pretty rag rug.
